| Name = H4 histone, family 3 caption = image = width = HGNCid = 4780 Symbol =

| ECnumber = Chromosome = 3 Arm = q Band = 13.13 LocusSupplementaryData =
}} 'Histone H4' is one of the 5 main histone proteins involved in the structure
of chromatin in eukaryotic cells. Featuring a main globular domain and a long N
terminal tail, H4 is a structural component of the nucleosome, and is subject to
covalent modification, including acetylation and methylation, which may alter
expression of genes located on DNA associated with its parent histone
octamer.
